pathAssistantSteps.info:
• Cultivation stage is where the Fundraiser details the strategy and steps to cultivate and then solicit the prospect for a major gift.
  • Relevant activity during this step should be added and outcome must be recorded for each cultivation step.
• 'Discontinued’ indicates that the opportunity has been lost. The ‘Loss Reason’ and ‘Loss Reason Explanation’ fields provide reasoning for the loss.
• ‘Executed’ indicates that the Contract has been executed and is in effect.

• ‘Identify’ indicates that you have identified a new opportunity from advancement with a prospective donor.
  • Complete the ‘Description’ section under the ‘Details’ tab by updating the ‘Giving Category’, and ‘Faculty Category’ fields. Other fields are pre-populated; however, may be updated.
  • Use ‘Notes’ to record relevant information to help you manage the relationship and/or opportunity. Use the ‘Activity’ panel to record your interactions and track tasks.
  • Record the documents that have been created with links to where they are stored under the 'Documents’ tab.

• Qualify stage indicates you are qualifying the donor opportunity and completing the Linkage, Interest and Ability Ranking under the ‘Qualify’ tab.
  • Once the qualification is complete, proceed to Cultivation stage. Use the ‘IS Qialified' and 'Qualification Summary’ to support the findings.

• Solicitation stage is where the Fundraiser formalises the major gift ask, providing the written proposal/Gift Management Plan to the prospect.
  • All proposed donation records must be added under Donation section, such as One off donation for saving Koala etc.
